intro: Ternatea vulgaris, commonly known as the common ternatea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves with three leaflets. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage. Ternatea vulgaris prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
